title: [bug] armv7 & aarch64 appimage bundler script 404 links

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

The [appimage bundler](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/ca45fdb01397f0ed527f359f3bf7fc664d04300f/tooling/bundler/src/bundle/linux/templates/appimage#L50) on armv7 devices attempts to download AppImageKit using armv7 which doesn't exist. The correct link uses armhf.

[appimage.rs (line 25)](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/ca45fdb01397f0ed527f359f3bf7fc664d04300f/tooling/bundler/src/bundle/linux/appimage.rs#L25) 
This function rewrites the architecture binary names so would be appropriate to change armv7 to armhf here. 

### Reproduction

_No response_

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Platform and versions

```text
Environment
  › OS: Ubuntu 20.04 X64
  › Node.js: 18.15.0
  › npm: 9.5.0
  › pnpm: 7.30.5
  › yarn: 1.22.19
  › rustup: 1.25.2
  › rustc: 1.68.1
  › cargo: 1.68.1
  › Rust toolchain: stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu 

Packages
  › @tauri-apps/cli [NPM]: 1.2.3
  › @tauri-apps/api [NPM]: 1.2.0
  › tauri [RUST]: 1.2.4,
  › tauri-build [RUST]: 1.2.1,
  › tao [RUST]: 0.15.8,
  › wry [RUST]: 0.23.4,

App
  › build-type: bundle
  › CSP: unset
  › distDir: dist
  › devPath: http://localhost:1420/
  › framework: React
  › bundler: Vite

App directory structure
  ├─ src-tauri
  ├─ .git
  ├─ node_modules
  ├─ public
  └─ src
```


### Stack trace

_No response_

### Additional context

Change
```rust
let arch = match settings.binary_arch() {
    "x86" => "i386",
    "x86_64" => "amd64",
    other => other,
};
```

To
```rust
let arch = match settings.binary_arch() {
    "x86" => "i386",
    "x86_64" => "amd64",
    "armv7" => "armhf",
    other => other,
};
```
